content:
MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
RISK-ON: Low volatility (20-day XU100 vol 13.1%) and broad participation with 5/8 sectors positive; volatility score +1 and breadth score +1. Conditions favor risk-taking and cyclical leadership.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Banking & Finance is the clear leader with broad gains: AKBNK (1W: +5.38% | 1M: +10.19%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: +6.25% | 1M: +5.57%) ABOVE TREND and ISCTR (1W: +5.19% | 1M: +3.60%) ABOVE TREND; Transportation and Heavy Industry also contributing via TAVHL (1W: +5.52% | 1M: +11.18%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +4.59% | 1M: +12.16%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Energy & Chemicals, Holding & Investment and Construction & REIT lag on a 1W basis: TUPRS (1W: -0.69% | 1M: -4.93%) BELOW TREND, DOHOL (1W: -6.78% | 1M: -0.74%) BELOW TREND and TKFEN (1W: -6.16% | 1M: +5.31%) CORRECTION indicate selective weakness despite broader market strength.

STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
VAKBN (1W: +6.74% | 1M: -0.63%) RECOVERY; YKBNK (1W: +6.66% | 1M: +3.14%) ABOVE TREND; GARAN (1W: +6.25% | 1M: +5.57%) ABOVE TREND; TAVHL (1W: +5.52% | 1M: +11.18%) ABOVE TREND; AKBNK (1W: +5.38% | 1M: +10.19%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
DOHOL (1W: -6.78% | 1M: -0.74%) BELOW TREND; TKFEN (1W: -6.16% | 1M: +5.31%) CORRECTION; PGSUS (1W: -5.57% | 1M: -3.32%) BELOW TREND; TRALT (1W: -4.46% | 1M: +18.46%) CORRECTION; KRDMD (1W: -3.41% | 1M: +1.16%) CORRECTION.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Upside momentum: VAKBN (1W: +6.74% | 1M: -0.63%) RECOVERY, YKBNK (1W: +6.66% | 1M: +3.14%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: +6.25% | 1M: +5.57%) ABOVE TREND. Downside momentum: DOHOL (1W: -6.78% | 1M: -0.74%) BELOW TREND, TKFEN (1W: -6.16% | 1M: +5.31%) CORRECTION, PGSUS (1W: -5.57% | 1M: -3.32%) BELOW TREND.

SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banks are the market engine—AKBNK (1W: +5.38% | 1M: +10.19%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: +6.25% | 1M: +5.57%) ABOVE TREND, ISCTR (1W: +5.19% | 1M: +3.60%) ABOVE TREND, YKBNK (1W: +6.66% | 1M: +3.14%) ABOVE TREND and VAKBN (1W: +6.74% | 1M: -0.63%) RECOVERY show confirmed strength—overweight selective large-cap banks.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry is constructive but mixed: ASELS (1W: +3.37% | 1M: +23.83%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +4.59% | 1M: +12.16%) ABOVE TREND lead, while VESTL (1W: -1.93% | 1M: -8.63%) BELOW TREND and ARCLK (1W: -3.05% | 1M: -1.78%) BELOW TREND warrant caution.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy shows dispersion—TRALT (1W: -4.46% | 1M: +18.46%) CORRECTION and GUBRF (quant leader) show strong longer-term scores but TUPRS (1W: -0.69% | 1M: -4.93%) BELOW TREND and SISE (1W: -1.36% | 1M: +4.54%) CORRECTION suggest rotation and sensitivity to oil/pricing news.

PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Risk-on stance: overweight large-cap banks and selected industrial cyclical winners (AKBNK, GARAN, ASELS, TOASO) and take profits or trim lagging holdings in holding/energy names; keep cash buffer for any short-term pullback given low vol backdrop.

NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
GARAN (1W: +6.25% | 1M: +5.57%) ABOVE TREND for earnings/loan growth sensitivity; AKBNK (1W: +5.38% | 1M: +10.19%) ABOVE TREND for macro beta; ASELS (1W: +3.37% | 1M: +23.83%) ABOVE TREND for momentum; TRALT (1W: -4.46% | 1M: +18.46%) CORRECTION as a mean-reversion candidate.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Banking & Finance for earnings and liquidity flows; Heavy Industry for continued cyclical leadership; Energy & Chemicals for commodity-driven volatility.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100’s 20-day moving average as near-term support and recent swing highs as resistance for continuation; catalysts: Q4 bank reports, CBRT communications, global risk sentiment and oil/commodity moves.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Risk-on environment with low volatility (13.1%) and 5/8 sectors positive; large-cap banks lead the move and are the primary overweight. Key risks: rotation into lagging energy/holding names and any surprise macro or central bank commentary that lifts volatility.
